meanings.definition: To revive or renew (a feeling or relationship)
meanings.sent1: After their argument, they rekindled their friendship by apologizing to each other.
meanings.sent2: The old friends rekindled their bond over a cup of tea.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully rekindled their rivalry during a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: Her smile rekindled his hope for a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The sunset rekindled memories of their childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: To ignite or light (a fire) again
meanings.sent1: He rekindled the campfire by adding more wood to it.
meanings.sent2: The camper rekindled the fire to keep warm in the chilly night.
meanings.sent3: The scout accidentally rekindled the fire when he tripped over a log.
meanings.sent4: The fireplace rekindled memories of cozy winter evenings.
meanings.sent5: The match rekindled the flame, lighting up the dark room.
